content:
EXISTING STRUCTURES
No new permanent structures have been successfully established on the map. Multiple attempts were made to supply a Lab at (0.5, 2.5) for research—with the Lab meant to serve as the research facility for Automation Science Packs—but none were placed due to inventory and crafting failures. Although furnaces (at positions (5.0, 5.0) and (–27.0, –60.0)) were referenced for smelting operations, these were pre‐existing processing units and were not newly created by the agent.

ERROR TIPS
• API Usage Errors
  – Ensure that API calls conform to the expected signature. In several instances get_entities was called with an unexpected keyword (‘radius’) or with incorrect positional arguments. Verify parameter names and counts before calling to avoid such type and argument errors.
  – When a function may return None, implement a proper fallback (for example, converting a None response to an empty list) to prevent iteration errors, as seen when attempting to filter labs.

• Lab Crafting and Placement Failures
  – Confirm that the Lab is available in the inventory before attempting placement. Errors such as “No lab in inventory” indicate that crafting must first successfully produce the Lab.
  – Carefully verify that all sub-ingredients for Lab production (including iron-gear-wheels, electronic-circuits, and copper-cables) are available. Missing prerequisite items led to failures in crafting the Lab.
  – Monitor the production chain dependencies; ensure upstream processes (like smelting iron and copper plates) yield sufficient resources to produce the required intermediate components.
